packages_with_data.title: Optimal Climate Policy When Damages Are Unknown
Optimal Life Cycle Unemployment Insurance
Individual Development Accounts and Homeownership among Low-Income Renters
Local Elites as State Capacity: How City Chiefs Use Local Information to Increase Tax Compliance in the D.R. Congo
The Effects of Working while in School: Evidence from Employment Lotteries
Work and Mental Health among Rohingya Refugees
Emoticons as Performance Feedback for College Students: A Large-Classroom Field Experiment
Reducing Inequality Through Dynamic Complementarity: Evidence from Head Start and Public School Spending
Effective Health Aid: Evidence from Gavi's Vaccine Program
Location, Location, Location
Rational Inattention and the Business Cycle Effects of Productivity and News Shocks
Resisting Social Pressure in the Household Using Mobile Money: Experimental Evidence on Microenterprise Investment in Uganda
Spillover, Efficiency and Equity Effects of Regional Firm Subsidies
Enemies of the People: The Long-Term Effects of Soviet Forced Labor Camps
National Solidarity Programme Impact on Security and Development (Afghanistan)
Estimating Models of Supply and Demand: Instruments and Covariance Restrictions
Eliciting ambiguity with mixing bets
The Anatomy of a Crackdown: Enforcement Strategies to Combat Illicit Opioid Distribution
Beliefs and Cooperation in Repeated Prisoner's Dilemma Games
Targeting Impact versus Deprivation
Contamination Bias in Linear Regressions
Land Rental Subsidies and Agricultural Productivity
Who Benefits from the Online Gig Economy?
Long-Run Impacts of Childhood Access to the Safety Net
packages_with_data.notes: Partial replication - county identifiers missing from public PSID. Used current FS receipt rather than childhood exposure. Cross-sectional analysis for time-invariant health outcome.
packages_with_data.note: Missing county IDs for original identification

packages_with_data.title: The Price of Experience
Keep It Simple: Financial Literacy and Rules of Thumb
Does Prison Make People Criminals? Evidence from Italian Collective Pardons
Competition and the Use of Foggy Pricing
Valuing the Wind: Renewable Energy and the Cost of Environmental Externalities
packages_with_data.notes: Cullen (2013). Hourly MEA of wind power in ERCOT. Newey-West HAC (24 lags) on pre-demeaned data. STRONG robustness: 100% negative, 98.8% sig at 5%. Baseline CO2 offset = -0.67 tons/MWh.

packages_with_data.title: New Evidence on Taxes and the Timing of Birth
packages_with_data.notes: Confidential IRS data - simulated data used. STRONG robustness: 98.1% positive, 90.4% sig at 5%. Tax incentives increase P(December birth) by ~1.1pp per $1000. Robust across controls, FE, functional forms, clustering, logit/probit, and IV. Placebos pass.

packages_with_data.title: Do Hospital Mergers Reduce Costs? Evidence on Prices and Hospital Market Consolidation
Referrals: Peer Screening and Enforcement in a Consumer Credit Field Experiment
Church-Based Childcare
packages_with_data.notes: Original paper uses structural GMM; reduced-form discrete choice specifications run. Weak support for competition effects.

packages_with_data.title: Incomplete Disclosure: Evidence of Signaling and Countersignaling
Social Networks and Economic Behavior: Dictator Game Experiments
Electoral Accountability and Corruption: Evidence from the Audits of Local Government
Paging Inspector Sands: The Costs of Public Information
packages_with_data.notes: Partial replication - only flow data available (Tables 8-9). Collision data requires license from City of Toronto.

packages_with_data.title: Workplace Friendships and Productivity
Disclosure by Politicians
packages_with_data.notes: Cross-country study of disclosure laws and government quality. MODERATE robustness - positive raw correlations but weakened by income controls.

packages_with_data.title: Does Electoral Competition Curb Party Favoritism?
Vocational Training for Disadvantaged Youth in Colombia: A Long Term Follow Up
packages_with_data.notes: Log extraction only - original data not included in replication package

packages_with_data.title: The Relative Power of Employment-to-Employment Reallocation and Unemployment Exits in Predicting Wage Growth
Team versus Individual Play in Finitely Repeated Prisoner Dilemma Games
packages_with_data.notes: Experimental economics - teams vs individuals in Prisoner Dilemma

packages_with_data.title: Political Connections and Sugar Mills in India
Ten isn't large! Group size and coordination in a large-scale experiment
The Geography of Trade in Online Transactions: Evidence from eBay and MercadoLibre
packages_with_data.notes: Confidential eBay data - used simulated transaction counts following paper coefficients

packages_with_data.title: When the Levee Breaks: Black Migration and Economic Development in the American South
Universalism: Global Evidence (V2)
Assortative Matching at the Top of the Distribution: Evidence from the World's Most Exclusive Marriage Market
Can Information Reduce Ethnic Discrimination? Evidence from Airbnb
Do Thank-You Calls Increase Charitable Giving? Expert Forecasts and Field Experimental Evidence
Does Patient Demand Contribute to the Overuse of Prescription Drugs?
Historical Lynchings and the Contemporary Voting Behavior of Blacks
Mental Health Costs of Lockdowns: Evidence from Age-Specific Curfews in Turkey
Recessions, Mortality, and Migration Bias: Evidence from the Lancashire Cotton Famine
The Side Effects of Immunity: Malaria and African Slavery in the United States
Checking and Sharing Alt-Facts
Child Marriage Bans and Female Schooling and Labor Market Outcomes: Evidence from Natural Experiments in 17 Low- and Middle-Income Countries
packages_with_data.notes: Simulated data - DHS and MACHEquity data require separate applications

packages_with_data.title: How Do Beliefs about the Gender Wage Gap Affect the Demand for Public Policy?
Mortality, Temperature, and Public Health Provision: Evidence from Mexico
Multinationals' Sales and Profit Shifting in Tax Havens
School Spending and Student Outcomes: Evidence from Revenue Limit Elections in Wisconsin
Student Performance, Peer Effects, and Friend Networks: Evidence from a Randomized Peer Intervention
The Labor Market Impacts of Universal and Permanent Cash Transfers: Evidence from the Alaska Permanent Fund
packages_with_data.notes: DiD robustness check of SCM paper. Main finding (no employment effect) supported. Evidence of intensive margin adjustments (part-time increase, hours decrease).

packages_with_data.title: The Long-Run Effects of Sports Club Vouchers for Primary School Children
packages_with_data.notes: WEAK support for main hypothesis. First-stage (program awareness) shows strong effects, but second-stage (sports club membership) shows no significant effects across 54 specifications.

packages_with_data.title: The Long-Term Effects of Measles Vaccination on Earnings and Employment
packages_with_data.notes: Simplified treatment due to computational constraints on 16M row dataset. Below 50 spec target.

packages_with_data.title: Yellow Vests, Pessimistic Beliefs, and Carbon Tax Aversion
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 97.4% positive, 93.5% significant at 5%. IV estimates larger than OLS (0.40-0.60 vs 0.36). Effect of beliefs on tax acceptance robust across subgroups.

packages_with_data.title: Declining Worker Turnover: The Role of Short-Duration Employment Spells
packages_with_data.notes: Descriptive/accounting decomposition paper. STRONG robustness - main finding (declining short-duration employment spells) holds across 93% of specifications with 88% significant at 5%.

packages_with_data.title: News Shocks under Financial Frictions
packages_with_data.notes: MODERATE robustness. FEVD of GDP to TFP shock median=16.9%, range 0.5%-62.5%. Results sensitive to sample period (financial crisis critical) and lag length. Cholesky identification used (paper uses medium-run ID not available in Python).

packages_with_data.title: Can Technology Solve the Principal-Agent Problem? Evidence from China's War on Air Pollution
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 90% positive, 83% significant at 5%. Effect of pollution monitoring automation on reported PM10.

packages_with_data.title: Enabling or Limiting Cognitive Flexibility? Evidence of Demand for Moral Commitment
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 96.6% positive coefficients, 77.6% significant at 5%. Main finding (demand for moral commitment predicts biased recommendations) highly robust across samples, controls, and inference methods.

packages_with_data.title: Evaluating Deliberative Competence: A Simple Method with an Application to Financial Choice
packages_with_data.notes: RCT of financial literacy intervention. MODERATE robustness - 92.7% positive, 69.1% significant at 5%. Simulated data used due to complex MPL structure.

packages_with_data.title: Interaction, Stereotypes, and Performance: Evidence from South Africa
packages_with_data.notes: RCT - mixed race roommate effects on IAT and academic outcomes. MODERATE robustness: 73.6% positive, 32.4% sig at 5%. Heterogeneous by race: black students academic gains, white students attitude improvements.

packages_with_data.title: Market Access and Quality Upgrading: Evidence from Four Field Experiments
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 96.3% positive, 68.5% sig at 5%. Market access RCT in Uganda.

packages_with_data.title: Measuring the Welfare Effects of Shame and Pride
packages_with_data.notes: Butera et al. Image concerns experiments (YMCA + Charity). STRONG robustness - 100% positive, 93% sig at 5%.

packages_with_data.title: Political Turnover, Bureaucratic Turnover, and the Quality of Public Services
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness for bureaucratic turnover (teacher/headmaster replacement), MODERATE robustness for test score effects. Political turnover RD study in Brazilian municipalities.

packages_with_data.title: Rebel on the Canal: Disrupted Trade Access and Social Conflict in China, 1650-1911
packages_with_data.notes: Canal closure DiD study. MODERATE robustness - 76.9% positive, 66.2% sig at 5%. Sensitive to winsorization and some placebo tests.

packages_with_data.title: Reshaping Adolescents' Gender Attitudes: Evidence from a School-Based Experiment in India
packages_with_data.notes: School-level RCT. MODERATE robustness - 88.7% positive, 13.2% sig at 5%. Boys show stronger effects (0.06 SD, sig) than girls (-0.02 SD, ns). Gender heterogeneity is key finding.

packages_with_data.title: Targeting High Ability Entrepreneurs Using Community Information: Mechanism Design in the Field
packages_with_data.notes: RCT with peer rankings. STRONG robustness - 90% positive, 77% sig at 5%.

packages_with_data.title: Technological Change and the Consequences of Job Loss
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 98.5% negative, 88.1% sig at 5%. Tech change (computer/software requirements) predicts larger earnings losses for displaced workers. Effect ~2.3% per SD.

packages_with_data.title: The Common-Probability Auction Puzzle
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 97.7% positive, 96.2% sig at 5%. CV auctions elicit higher bids (~15 unit premium) vs CP auctions across all experiments.

packages_with_data.title: The Relative Efficiency of Skilled Labor across Countries: Measurement and Interpretation
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 89.6% positive, 85.1% significant at 5%. AQ-GDP elasticity ~1.4, Q-GDP elasticity ~0.1.

packages_with_data.title: Vulnerability and Clientelism
When a Doctor Falls from the Sky: The Impact of Easing Doctor Supply Constraints on Mortality
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 98.8% negative coefficients for main outcome (mort7), 49.4% sig at 5%. RCT adding doctors to health facilities reduces 7-day infant mortality.

packages_with_data.title: Motivated Beliefs and Anticipation of Uncertainty Resolution
packages_with_data.notes: Lab experiment on motivated beliefs. MODERATE robustness - 88.6% positive, 49.6% significant at 5%.

packages_with_data.title: Wage Cyclicality and Labor Market Sorting
Digital Addiction
packages_with_data.notes: RCT of phone usage limits and bonus incentives. Strong support for main hypothesis.

packages_with_data.title: The Impacts of Microfinance: Evidence from Joint-Liability Lending in Mongolia
packages_with_data.notes: RCT - group loan vs control. MODERATE robustness: 80% positive, 51% sig at 5%.

packages_with_data.title: Yours, Mine and Ours: Do Divorce Laws Affect the Intertemporal Behavior of Married Couples?
packages_with_data.notes: Voena (2015). Panel FE analysis of unilateral divorce x property regime effects on household assets. MODERATE robustness: 77% positive, 42% sig at 5%.

packages_with_data.title: Work from Home before and after the COVID-19 Outbreak (RPS Data)
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 98% positive, 100% sig at 5%. College education associated with 18pp higher WFH share. Survey data release.

packages_with_data.title: Entrepot: Hubs, Scale, and Trade Costs
packages_with_data.notes: Gravity equation analysis using publicly available auxiliary data (BACI trade, CEPII gravity, CERDI sea distance). Proprietary shipping data not available - focused on reduced-form gravity regressions (Table A11 analogs). STRONG robustness: 97% significant at 5%, 95% with expected negative sign. Median distance elasticity -1.12.

packages_with_data.title: The Franchise, Policing, and Race: Evidence from Arrests Data and the Voting Rights Act
packages_with_data.notes: Long-difference cross-sectional analysis. VRA coverage x black_share60 as treatment. Proxy for black_share60 used (child nonwhite share) since Census pop data is private ICPSR. 78 specs: 79% negative coef (consistent with paper), 15% sig at 5%, 24% at 10%. MODERATE robustness.

packages_with_data.title: Who Watches the Watchmen? Local News and Police Behavior in the United States
packages_with_data.notes: Google Trends analysis (Table 4) replicated with 63 specifications. Primary UCR clearance rate analysis (Table 2) requires proprietary ICPSR data (2009-2016). Station-DMA mapping reconstructed from public callsign data. 87% same sign as baseline, 6% sig at 5%, 17% sig at 10%. WEAK robustness - results are directionally consistent but generally insignificant, consistent with paper's secondary supporting evidence role.

packages_with_data.title: Polity Size and Local Government Performance: Evidence from India
Life Insurance and Household Consumption
packages_with_data.notes: Hong & Rios-Rull (2010). Structural calibration paper. Reduced-form analysis of PSID marital transition data underlying the structural model. 85 specifications examining gender effects on divorce, marriage formation, widowhood, and household composition changes. MODERATE robustness: 29% sig at 5%, with strong gender effects on widowhood and mixed results on divorce.

packages_with_data.title: Product Creation and Destruction: Evidence and Price Implications
Runs on Money Market Mutual Funds
The Finnish Great Depression: From Russia with Love
packages_with_data.notes: Cross-sectional OLS of industry employment deviations on Soviet export exposure. MODERATE robustness: 63% of comparable specs significant at 5%. Sensitive to detrending methodology.

packages_with_data.title: Sovereign Debt Booms in Monetary Unions
packages_with_data.notes: Purely theoretical calibration paper. Mathematica code solves HJB ODEs. Python replication with 80 parameter sensitivity specifications. All key model outputs (Vaut, bPi, bstar, bmax, bmaxNoPi) replicated within numerical tolerance.

packages_with_data.title: The Impact of Medical Liability Standards on Regional Variations in Physician Behavior
The Burden of Debt (Martinez-Marquina and Shi 2024)
Screening, Competition, and Job Design
Automobiles on Steroids: Product Attribute Trade-Offs and Technological Progress in the Automobile Sector
Accounting for the Growth of MNC-based Trade using a Structural Model of U.S. MNCs
packages_with_data.notes: Keane (2006). Structural MLE of MNC behavior (Fortran 77). Confidential BEA data - no re-estimation possible. 151 specs from 168 parameter estimates across technology, demand, trade cost, discrete choice, and variance-covariance components. 69% significant at 5%.

packages_with_data.title: Monetary Policy, Financial Stability, and the Zero Lower Bound
Understanding International Prices: Customers as Capital
Search, Liquidity, and the Dynamics of House Prices and Construction
Learning to Coordinate: A Study in Retail Gasoline
The Empire Project: Trade Policy in Interwar Canada
Breastfeeding and Child Development
packages_with_data.notes: Confidential UK MCS data - results extracted from Stata output files. IV using weekend birth timing as instrument for breastfeeding duration. STRONG robustness for cognitive outcomes (100% positive, 79% sig). WEAK for health outcomes.

packages_with_data.title: What Determines Giving to Hurricane Katrina Victims?
packages_with_data.notes: Fong & Luttmer (2009). Experimental study: picshowblack treatment on giving. WEAK robustness for main effect (0% sig at 5% for giving). Consistent with paper - main contribution is heterogeneous effects (interactions), not main effect. Manipulation check STRONG (per_hfhdif always sig).

packages_with_data.title: Demand and Defective Growth Patterns: The Role of the Tradable and Non-Tradable Sectors in an Open Economy
packages_with_data.notes: Descriptive/accounting decomposition paper. Tradable sector share of gross VA gains post-crisis = 51.5% (paper claim confirmed). WEAK statistical support - 89% positive coefficients in recovery period but 0% significant at 5%. Small cross-section (N=34) limits power.

packages_with_data.title: Six Randomized Evaluations of Microcredit: Introduction and Further Steps
packages_with_data.notes: Banerjee, Karlan, Zinman. Introduction to AEJ microcredit special issue. MIX Market data on MFI characteristics across 6 countries. Descriptive statistics for Table 1 (APR, loan loss, portfolio size). No regressions in original code; spec search adds OLS of APR on country dummies. Mexico APR premium highly robust (100% sig at 5%). Mean APR sensitive to compounding method and Mexico inclusion.

packages_with_data.title: Teaching the Tax Code: Earnings Responses to an Experiment with EITC Recipients
packages_with_data.notes: Confidential microdata (H&R Block). Specs extracted from permutation test output (coeff_final.dta). 130 specifications: 24 KS tests + 106 regressions.

packages_with_data.title: Improving the Design of Conditional Transfer Programs: Evidence from a Randomized Education Experiment in Colombia
Do Opposites Detract? Intrahousehold Preference Heterogeneity and Inefficient Strategic Savings
packages_with_data.notes: RCT/observational hybrid. Strong robustness: 96.9% of primary outcome specs sig at 5%. Poorly matched couples save individually 10.6pp more.

packages_with_data.title: Testing Paternalism: Cash versus In-Kind Transfers
Diabetes and Diet: Purchasing Behavior Change in Response to Health Information
Expertise vs. Bias in Evaluation: Evidence from the NIH
The Causal Effect of Competition on Prices and Quality: Evidence from a Field Experiment
packages_with_data.notes: Busso & Galiani. RCT of market entry in Dominican Republic. ITT and IV/2SLS with clustered SEs. STRONG robustness: 93.8% negative price coefficients, 64.1% sig at 5%. 211 specifications across samples, control sets, outcomes, and methods.

packages_with_data.title: High Trade Costs and Their Consequences: An Estimated Dynamic Model of African Agricultural Storage and Trade
Marriage Networks, Nepotism and Labor Market Outcomes in China
Technology, International Trade, and Pollution from U.S. Manufacturing
The Importance of Being Wanted
ACA Health Insurance Markets: Adverse Selection via Website Glitches
packages_with_data.notes: MODERATE robustness - 96.4% positive (primary outcome), 17.9% sig at 5%, 50% sig at 10%. Glitch states had ~12% higher cost growth. Small cross-section (5 treat + 8 control states) limits power. Placebo tests pass. Lagged controls strongly significant.

packages_with_data.title: Teacher Value-Added, Salary, and Contract Status in Pakistan
Training Microentrepreneurs (SEWA Business Training RCT)
Sharing Demographic Risk -- Who is Afraid of the Baby Bust?
packages_with_data.notes: Ludwig & Reiter. Calibrated OLG model with demographic shocks. MATLAB/Maxima code translated to Python for steady-state computation. 87 parameter sensitivity specifications for no-government steady state. Primary outcome: annualized K/Y ratio. ROBUST to parameter variations.

packages_with_data.title: Are Tax Incentives for Charitable Giving Efficient?
packages_with_data.notes: Fack & Landais (2010). Confidential French tax return data - simulated. 3-step censored quantile regression (Chernozhukov & Hong). STRONG robustness: 98.8% positive, 95.2% sig at 5% (comparable specs). Price elasticity of giving ~1.1-1.7.

packages_with_data.title: Mafia in the Ballot Box
packages_with_data.notes: De Feo & De Luca. IV of Mafia presence on DC vote share and construction employment in Sicily 1946-1992. Instrument: historical Mafia (1900). STRONG robustness: 97% positive, 81% sig at 5% for DC_VV. 94% positive, 81% sig for bui_labf. First-stage F~62. Overid with sulfur instrument confirms.

packages_with_data.title: Is the EITC as Good as an NIT? Conditional Cash Transfers and Tax Incidence
Stealth Consolidation: Evidence from an Amendment to the Hart-Scott-Rodino Act
Immigration, Employment Opportunities, and Criminal Behavior
The Role of Information in Disability Insurance Application
Screening in Contract Design: Evidence from the ACA Health Insurance Exchanges
Does the election of a female leader clear the way for more women in politics?
How Punishment Severity Affects Jury Verdicts
On the Empirics of the EU Regional Policy: The Effect of Objective 1 on Growth and Investment
Environmental Preferences and Technological Choices: Is Market Competition Clean or Dirty?
Reported Effects vs Revealed-Preference Estimates: Evidence from the Propensity to Spend Tax Rebates
When Work Disappears: Manufacturing Decline and the Falling Marriage-Market Value of Young Men
Foreign Competition and Domestic Innovation: Evidence from U.S. Patents
packages_with_data.notes: Autor, Dorn, Hanson, Pisano, Shu (2020). IV/2SLS of Chinese import penetration on US patenting. Baseline coef=-1.35, SE=0.50 (replicates Stata exactly). MODERATE robustness: 93% negative, 69% sig at 5%, 79% sig at 10%. Robust to controls, outcomes, clustering. Sensitive to weighting (unweighted not sig) and single-period estimates (1991 not sig). Pre-period placebos pass. Effects concentrated in low capital-intensity firms.

packages_with_data.title: Does Turnover Inhibit Specialization? Evidence from a Skill Survey in Peru
Debt Traps? Market Vendors and Moneylender Debt in India and the Philippines
Pollution, Poverty, and Potentially Progressive Instruments
Real Effects of Sovereign Debt Inflow Shocks
Promotions and Productivity: The Role of Meritocracy and Pay Progression in the Public Sector
The Formation of Expectations, Inflation and the Phillips Curve
The dollar, bank leverage and deviations from covered interest parity
packages_with_data.notes: STRONG robustness - 100% same sign (main specs), 94.6% sig at 5%. Dollar appreciation widens CIP deviations and reduces dollar cross-border lending. Robust across control sets, samples, currency subsets, estimation methods, and winsorization.

packages_with_data.title: Elasticity Optimism
packages_with_data.notes: Imbs & Mejean. Trade elasticity estimation using Caliendo-Parro method. Three levels: sector-by-sector OLS (21 sectors), pooled micro with sector FE, aggregate OLS. MODERATE robustness: sector estimates robust (-5.6 baseline, range -7.5 to -0.5), pooled estimates moderately robust (-3.6 baseline, 86% sig at 5%), aggregate estimates fragile (-2.7 baseline, 0% sig at 5%). Core hierarchy (|micro|>|pooled|>|macro|) preserved across specs.

packages_with_data.title: The Good News-Bad News Effect: Asymmetric Processing of Objective Information about Yourself
Is China Socialist?
packages_with_data.notes: Naughton (2017). Descriptive accounting paper - no regressions in original. Spec search adds formal trend tests on consolidated revenue/GDP (1996-2015, N=20). STRONG robustness: 87% positive, 94% sig at 5%. Trend = +1.54 pp/year. All components trending up. Leave-one-out 100% stable. Deceleration after 2008. By 2010-2015, China exceeds OECD average revenue/GDP.

packages_with_data.title: School Counselors and Advanced Placement Recommendations
packages_with_data.notes: Francis et al. Audit experiment of school counselor bias in AP recommendations. Names signal race, gender, SES. WEAK-MODERATE robustness: blackfem on rating positive but insignificant (3% sig at 5%, 24% at 10%). blackfem on recommend marginal (56% sig at 5% across methods). whitemale on recommend most robust finding (100% sig at 5%). Pooled blackname effect weak (8% sig at 5%).

packages_with_data.title: Relative Goods Prices, Pure Inflation, and the Phillips Correlation
The Effects of Monetary Policy on Stock Market Bubbles: Some Evidence
Market Structure, Reputation, and the Value of Quality Certification
Robot Hubs: Robot Hubs and the Use of Robotics in US Manufacturing Establishments
